body.name: Blackberry Tour 9630 GSM Unlocked Cell Phone with 3.2 MP Camera and GPS - Unlocked Phone - No Warranty - Black
features: BlackBerry smartphone with QWERTY keyboard; dual-network capable for 3G-enabled GSM access when traveling abroad
Sprint Mobile Broadband Network via EV-DO connectivity; GPS turn-by-turn directions via Sprint Navigation; Sprint TV and Sprint Music Store enabled
3.2-megapixel camera/camcorder; Bluetooth stereo music; MicroSD memory expansion to 16 GB; access to personal and corporate email
Up to 5 hours of talk time, up to 336 hours (14 days) of standby time

Unlocked cell phones are compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T and T-Mobile as well as with GSM SIM cards (e.g. H20, Straight Talk, and select prepaid carriers). Unlocked cell phones will not work with CDMA Carriers like Sprint, Verizon, Boost or Virgin.
body.description: The BlackBerry Tour 9630 weighs 4.58 ounces and measures 4.4 x 2.4 x 0.6 inches. Its 1400 mAh lithium-ion battery is rated at up to 5 hours of talk time, and up to 336 hours (14 days) of standby time. It runs on the 800/1900 MHz CDMA frequencies and is compatible with the EV-DO 3G data network when on the Sprint network in the US; in international territories, it's compatible with 850/900/1800/1900 MHz GSM/GPRS/EDGE networks as well as 2100 MHz 3G (UMTS) networks.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 3.6 3.6 out of 5 stars 82 ratings 3.6 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars very good phone
reviews.reviewText: i like it! it is a nice phone in a good condition of services. i will recommend this to any customers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2015
reviews.reviewText: I am not a stranger to this blackberry, although this is an old smartphone but like older cellular phones this phone is built as a brick and even more secure than more modern models. Prior to purchasing I did my research and reviewed many comments on both the product and seller. The product like all Verizon branded smartphones comes unlocked the trick which many blackberry users already now is switching the band from CDMA to using the SIM, once all configurations are done and the sim installed this unit is by far one of the best blackberry phones available. It is snappy, responsive and the battery life is excellent, In regards to the seller, the product was as advertised, it arrived well protected and if the opportunity arises I will buy from the seller again. In conclusion the phone for the offering price is a great deal and will never cease to impress like all blackberry phones

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2013
reviews.reviewText: I give it to a family member in another country and it is great no problems; I will be looking for more great deals on them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars poor product BB Tour 9630
reviews.reviewText: i purchased this product because the info says UNLOCKED and im happy i've something to use when i travel outside USA --- it was one of my greatest disappointments i can not even use the cell phone with my T-Mobile SIM card while in Texas --- i went to a cell phone doctor and they failed to work on its ""unlocked"" feature ----- i contacted the seller - gave me a procedure on how to unlock the system --- negative results ------ i went to Galveston Island and tossed the BB Tour 9630 right there in the Gulf Of Mexico :) :) :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars BB Tour 9630 GSM unlocked cell phone with 3.2 Camera and GPS with fast processing from supplier
reviews.reviewText: This cell phone is really good, I even ordered one for my wife who was using my cell phone and was pleased with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Just not it
reviews.reviewText: They did not explain that you will have a lot of trouble trying to activate and get ride of the"activation required".It is just not simple for those who just want to plug their sim card and start their phone.I have just learnt a lesson which is to pay the most to get the best,never again.I will buy me an Iphone 5 and get peace of mind.There is no wonder Blackberry is dying because of those many little complication to use their phones.It sucks.I will donate this one to charity but you have to tell your customer that your phones are not that unlocked and they need to go through a long process that can lead them to spend another sum of money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars I had no problems but one
reviews.reviewText: This is a great phone for international purposes (that is, if you plan on using it in countries where blackberries still prevail), however because the Tour is not a popular as other models, it does not always work. Sometimes the "EDGE" (proof that internet is flowing) will shut down, not because of your network service provider, but because of the phone itself.The phone wasn't really meant to work outside of the country it was made, so you'll find it sometimes becomes incompatible with the service. If this doesn't matter, then it's a great deal.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Came as described by seller!
